t: Psalm 103
A Psalm of David.
Bless*p the Lord,*s O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
Bless*p the Lord,*s O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
Who*p forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy diseases;
Who*p redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
Who*p satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle's.
The*p Lord*s executeth righteousness and judgment for all that are oppressed.
He*p made known his ways unto Moses, his acts unto the children of Israel.
The*p Lord*s is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
He*p will not always chide: neither will he keep his anger for ever.
He*p hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
For*p as the heaven is high above the earth, so great is his mercy toward them that fear him.
As*p far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
Like*p as a father pitieth his children, so the Lord*s pitieth them that fear him.
For*p he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.
As*p for man, his days are as grass: as a flower of the field, so he flourisheth.
For*p the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place thereof shall know it no more.
But*p the mercy of the Lord*s is from everlasting to everlasting upon them that fear him, and his righteousness unto children's children;
To*p such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
The*p Lord*s hath prepared his throne in the heavens; and his kingdom ruleth over all.
Bless*p the Lord,*s ye his angels, that excel in strength, that do his commandments, hearkening unto the voice of his word.
Bless*p ye the Lord,*s all ye his hosts; ye ministers of his, that do his pleasure.
Bless*p the Lord,*s all his works in all places of his dominion: bless the Lord,*s O my soul.
